description: Purchase a mech of a design type your stable had a signature mech lost to being cored last week. Can be any in config but has to modified to custom specs. Pay cost in C-Bills & it is delivered next broadcast week. Becomes a signature mech of the pilot who lost his.
Purchase the parts to create a standard config of an Omnimech your stable owns.

Purchase a Mech of any design you have the tech contracts for. It arrives next broadcasst week if it is from your faction list. Otherwise it arrives in three broadcast weeks. For each additional two points on the cost, decrease delivery time by one week. Pay cost of mech in C-Bills.

Purchase a new battlearmour unit type you have a contract for. Pay for the cost of suits to number of troops in Battle Armour Pilot squad (4-6). Costs two point for green suits (Sloth & Infiltrator Mk I), three for yellow, and four for red. They arrive next broadcast week if it is from your faction list. Otherwise it arrives in three broadcast weeks. For each additional two points on the cost, decrease delivery time by one week.
Based on a created weapon design, buy it. Pay for as per cost.
Create a design for a carried mech weapon.
Modify up to two locations on a Mech.
Modify two locations of pods on a currently owned config of an omnimech

Modify a mech on up to every location. Pay the cost of all equipment added as if damage repair. Can be used specifically to Overhaul the base frame to add 5-10 tons to the mechs frame. No locations are modified in this use.
Choose a new supply contract. If another stable has this contract, add it immediately. Otherwise roll to make contract.

Propose a new black tech to research. Outline details of the technology to the group and they have to bring back feedback on grounds to balance the equipment. At the beginning of the next week, use the First supply contract to buy the tech unless two players specifically object to it.
Propose a review of an available black tech for balance.

Name a major industrial corp and associate it with a star or champion pilot this week. Gain 1,000,000 C-Bills and 5 pop to that pilots league or network match. Bonus of 1,000,000 C-Billss on a victory.
Name a major industrial corporation and plug it during each match. Gain 500,000 CBills and 2 pop each league and network match this week and an extra 500,000 on each victory.

Place a pilot from your stable into doing a touring date, attending events and giving talks for the week instead of piloting this week. For each fame of the pilot he earns 1,000,000 C-Bills for the week. Half for Contenders and Rookies who don't hold titles.
Allocate the signature mech of a pilot to a public display. May not be used for the broadcast week but the pilot gains 12 points to Pop for fame roll at start of next broadcast week.
Roll on the random pilot tables to create a talented new hire to add to your stable. For 4 points have +1 on your choice of single roll. You must pay 75% of value of any signature mech.
Recruit new 5/6 rookies of your faction to your stable. Recruit 3 for 2 points, 6 for 3 points and 10 pilots for 4 points.
Recruit a squad of four battle armour pilots. If the stable has no Battle armour they are automatically deployable as Power Armor.
Heal a pilot one wound.
Select a pilot with Ego, Combat Phobias, Drug Addiction, PTSD, or Sexual Deviant. Defer that derangement for this week.
Select a pilot and allocate them to a health spa for the broadcast week. They may not be fielded, but heal 3 wounds, or one wound and a black mark.
Select a pilot with Ego, Combat Phobia, or Drug Addiction, PTSD, or Sexual Deviant, and try to cure it with therapy. Roll 2d6 on pilot derangement recovery table.
Pick a pilot and roll 2d6 on the surgery table to heal wounds and black marks.

Publicly sue another stable for slander or libel. Mouthing off is par for the course but opens many legal windows. Roll 1d6 and one a 3+ win the case and gain the roll times 200,000 C-bills from the target stable.

Assist an arena to sue another stable who had a pilot in a fight cause dramatic damage to the arena. Roll 1d6 + the number of buildings destroyed or hexes set on fire against at arget of 7. If successful, the stable loses 200,000 C-Bills each class of tree or building (Ie a heavy building is 600k, heavy woods are 400k) and you collect half.

Chose an enemy stable and randomly select a pilot. Roll 1d6. On a 2+ your lawyers make the Solaris Gaming Board investigate the background of the pilot, locking him from being deployed this week. Add 2 to the target value if you select the specific pilot. Stable Champion adds a second +2 to the target. Any title adds +1.

Chose an enemy stable and randomly select a Mech Roll 1d6. On a 2+ your lawyers make the authorities investigate the background of the Mech, locking it from being deployed this week. Add 2 to the target value if you select the specific Mech Add +1 for signature Mechs

If an opponent in a fight or action used a cheat and got caught, you can sue him with this action. Roll 1d6-3. For multiply the positive number by 50% and claim that amount of the Purse or the most expensive lost Mech or Prize, in C-Bills.

After losing a pilot with a signature mech, you can pay to keep ownership of the Mech to the stable. Roll 1d6 and add 1 per 250,000 C-Bills spent. On a 6 or higher, pay half the value of the Mech and keep it. Omnimechs with shared owner gain +3 on roll.
Invest in a rival stable's prosperity. Take 2d6% of their winnings for the week.

The lawyers sit down to discuss the ramifications of a pilot and his derangement - Adrenaline Junkie, Bully, Criminal, Family, Gambler, Sexual Deviant, Tinkerer, or User of Illegal Performance enhancers. Roll 2d6 on the Pilot derangement recovery table.

Pick an enemy pilot with one of the derangements Bully, Criminal, Drama Queen, Family, Gambler, Religious Zealot, Sexual Deviant, Tinkerer, or User of illegal performance enhancers. End any current deferment, or add +2 to this weeks roll (or re-roll if already rolled).
Circle the Legal Sharks around your stable. Apply a +2 to the targe numbers of legal actions against your stable this week.
Select a pilot of your stable. He and his signature mechs cannot be targeted by hostile security actions this week.
Send in one of the lads to hack or bribe an error into an enemy modification action. Add four to the modification balance check roll.

Choose and enemy stable and randomly determine a pilot. Some of your boys track down this pilot and help him have an 'Accident'. Pilot takes 1d6-2 wounds. Roll with a further -2 if you choose the targeted pilot.

Allocate security to watch and forcibly assist a pilot with an issue he has of â€“ Ego, Bully, Criminal, Drama queen, Drug addiction, Family, Gambler, Religious zealot, sexual deviant, Tinkerer, or user of illegal performance enhancers. Roll 2d6 on the Pilot derangement recovery table.
Pick an enemy pilot with one of the derangements Adrenaline Junkie, Drug Addiction, Gambler, or PTSD. End any current deferments or add +2 to this weeks roll, or reroll if already rolled.

Select a Signature mech on a Expo Display Mech tour and have it sabotaged. When next fielded roll one random location and roll for a crit (max one) to be disabled at the start of the fight. Re-roll kill results.
All pilots in nominated fight get +4 pop. Nominate which fight immediately.
Spend 250,000 C-Bills and raise one pilot from contender to Star.
When forced to reduce a star to contender, add 2 to target number to avoid the star leaving the stable. (1d6 needs a 6 instead of 4+)
Allocate the signature mech of a deceased star of champion pilot to your hall of fame, giving one point to prominence calculations in the future just like a dead star or champion does.

Have a reporter sit down with a pilot to express the points on his mind, specifically Religious Zealot, Family Problems, Drama Queen, PTSD, or Tinkerer. Roll on the pilot derangement recovery table but on a 3 or less, lose 1 fame or gain ego if zero fame.

Pick an enemy pilot and work with the media for a targeted story on his derangements, putting massive pressure on the pilot. End any deferment or add +2 to this weeks rolls, or reroll if already rolled.
Pick an enemy stable of opposing reputation and justify a challenge. Each pilot earns bonus pop equal to the difference in reputation and 1,000,000 C-Bills on victories (Not including simulators).
Spend 250,000 C-Bills per pilot and raise up to four contenders to stars.

Allocate a pilot to a reality TV show. The pilot may not be fielded this broadcast week in a fight, however his appearance gives 12 Pop for the week to the pilot. If multiple stables do this action, they are on the same show, however the highest ranking pilots over shadow the lower, so if you are not the highest ranking pilot on the show, drop to 8 Pop. For each of the highest ranking pilots on the show after the first, add +2 pop.

A pilots name is his brand, and so to change it lightly is to lose recognition, specifically all fame. With this ability you make sure the advertising for the pilot does not sacrifice his fame completely. Lose only one fame in the name change. This ability applies to three pilots for 2 points. To six pilots for 3 points, and to 10 pilots for 4 points. One point cheaper with Under New Management action.
Make a joke name of an enemy pilot linked to events of a fight of last broadcast week. Use advertising to force the name on the pilot.
Send a Star or Champion to a training camp for the broadcast week. He may not fight this week but gains up to half the training points of the Contenders next broadcast week.
Add 6 more slots for Mechs and Pilots in stable.
Add 9 more slots for Mechs and Pilots in the stable.
Draw an extra event card.

This is a special action that can rarely be taken. Any stable can take it once, to change the faction allegiance of the stable for preference of the Stable player. An exception to taking it once, is if a new pilot becomes a champion of the stable, who is not of the stables current faction. His new position can be leveraged to change allegiance of the stable. This change comes the a change of training skill sets, and a change in faction Mech list. If taken just to refine Player preference, A new name must be taken, and while most details are unchanged, this results in the loss of the Honoured Dead roster.

Participate in the start of week Auction. This action is repeatable. This action can be turned into a Dregs Purchase or Home Development action if no successful auction bid is made before auction ends.
Select a mech by weight point and receive immediately a random mech from the rental pool. Pay mech cost in C-bills.
Select a mech and modify one location on the mech.
Recruit a new 5/6 Rookie pilot of your faction to your stable.
Apply a +2 to the target number of a legal action against you.

Pay an insider for placement advantage. Reserve a starting location that cannot be selected by anyone but you during placement, whether you use it or not. Alternatively select a starting condition of a map variable, such as wall heights in the Colosseum, Obstacle placement, etc. May be selected after placement.
Delay the start of the fight till Twilight or Night conditions. Declare during fight setup.
Send a pro team to sabutage audience facilities, with media support and inappropriate t-shirt cannons, to rile up the live crowd, imposing angry crowd on the fight.
Send a pilot to a Children's hospital or charity event for quick pop bump of +12. If the pilot also fights in a Sim or Underground fight this week, apply one hit from the strain.

Send a pilot who did not fight to a game show at the end of the broadcast week. Game shows are like reality shows but more action based. Gain 10+1d6 Pop. One a one or two on the 1d6, gain that many hits.
Designate a fight during the week during the fight setup, pick one opponent mech during the fight. Gain fame automatically if you are in on the kill of that mech.
Restock an event card to draw another.
Restock a cheat card and gain one face.
